name: grovellingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that involves behaving with too much respect towards someone, because you want to please them or want them to forgive you: He was grovellingly polite to the judge. When he heard about the revelations he grovellingly apologized. Related words
grovelling adjective mainly UK disapproving
grovel (TRY TO PLEASE)
More examplesFewer examplesThey grovellingly admitted their mistake.He was explaining grovellingly about how he came to park his car in the wrong space.The presenter introduced his guest grovellingly.People are pleased, not grovellingly grateful, to have a job in this sector.There was criticism of his grovellingly sycophantic interview with the country’s leader.Newspapers remained grovellingly on message.
